name: Belludi 37

reviews.title: A Perfect Time in Padua
reviews.text: We found Padua to be a wonderful city and the Belludi 37 hotel couldn't have been better! We arrived late (due to train problems) and the hotel staff quickly checked us in, got us settled and made us dinner reservations at a delicious restaurant a few minutes walk away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious and comfortable - lots of storage, great bed... and a view of St. Anthony's that was spectacular. Breakfast was perfect. We used the bikes to tour the town and had a wonderful day biking all over town.
reviews.title: 7* Service!!! Just "WOW"!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of our favorite stays in Italy! Thanks Belludi 37 for everything!!
reviews.title: Owner Magnificent Mauro will treat you like royalty...look no further!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really didn't know if I should stay at this hotel - because it rates itself 2*. But due to the perfect rating in tripadviser I decided to take the risk.
reviews.title: outstanding boutique hotel in terrific location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Normally I'm staying at 4* or 5* hotels, such as W, Four Seasons, Oberoi, Taj... - but such a good service as at the "Belludi37" I didn't receive even at the Luxury Hotels in India.
reviews.title: What a delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed here. The hotel is a charming, small hotel but most importantly of all , it is run by good, caring people. I wasn't feeling well when we arrived and the owner and her staff went out of their way to assist me in obtaining medical attention. The hotel is located in the heart of Padua and we hope to stay there again on some future vacation.
reviews.title: Friendly People

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, fantastic staff, nothing too much, wonderful breakfast - best we had in Italy. Modern decor but with ancient window shutters, great combination. Free internet access. Very helpful restaurant suggestions. Definitely would return next time we are in Padua.
reviews.title: Ideal mid price in Padua

reviews.text: We had an excellent stay at this charming small “hip hotel” in a great location.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel with great attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located in an historic building in the centre of the city. The rooms were clean and designed along the lines of more expensive hotels, with the kind of furniture you might put into a modern apartment. It felt a little like staying with stylish friends – and what more could you want! This was supplemented by the friendly welcome and, in our case, help with parking the car.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service - Highly Recommended!

reviews.text: Padua has a wealth of coffee shops, restaurants and bars and there are many choices within a five minute radius of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel!

reviews.text: I was traveling with my 76 yo mother. it was the beginning of a 30 days trip to Italy and we just had arrived from Milano. Since the beginning we felt a huge difference as we were received with smiles, an espresso and cookies. The hotel do not have an elevator and my mother have a bad knee, but we stayed at the first floor ,rooms facing the main street, but no noise at all during the night.
reviews.title: Spectacular little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They didn`t had any room with double beds, and iI took another room for me with an special low fare. The rooms were airy, spacious and furnished with taste. The hotel stands in a old house completely renovated and quite near from the St Antonio Basilica. The reception team was amazing on provide info and everything we needed. The restaurant they indicated was the BEST and one of the CHEAPEST we had in the whole trip.
reviews.title: SUPERIOR customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the end we received a bottle of excellent wine as a gift.
reviews.title: Belludi 37 - best choice in Padova

reviews.text: As a Brazilian I`m used to warmth and coziness.
reviews.title: Very nearly perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I received everything there.
reviews.title: Friendly, Modern, Clean, Quiet, Centrally Located, Reasonable Rates

reviews.text: I didn't want to leave the hotel. The directions from the train station were easy to follow. The greeting from the staff was incredible- served a cold beverage of my choice as they showed me the sites of Padua. They were also very helpful about recommending restaurants that were good, not too expensive.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They upgraded my room at no additional cost, so my room was great, although I am sure all the rooms are nice and well designed, as is the entire hotel.
reviews.title: Stunning and Hip Room/Could Sleep All Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was another 7E, but well worth it.
reviews.title: nice, cosy and ideally located

reviews.text: Best hotel I've stayed in Italy. I'll be back!
reviews.title: Perfect. I wish I could find a hotel like this wherever I go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Hotel Belludi are amazing. We were welcomed with an espresso. Note when you arrive it is just past the Church of St. Anthony. To park (if you have reserved) pull in to the small street behind first. Be careful not to go past their marked gate as it's a restricted area for cars. The staff assisted us in bringing our luggage to to room. The room was clean and comfortable. The shower does take a few minutes to get warm but other then that no complaints. After a long day of sight seeing we were even greated with a satchel of lavender (I think that's what's in it) on our bed. There is a complimentary fridge with cold water and sodas upon arrival. Great value. Splended hotel.
reviews.title: We Loved this Hotel!

description: The hotel takes its name Belludi37 from the central via Belludi, which links the Basilica of Sant'Anthony, the icon of the city, to one of the most fascinating squares in Europe, Prato della Valle. The building is early twentieth century, with interiors recently renewed and enriched with dècor of contemporary design. The rooms, cared for every detail, reflect the concept of our hospitality: "refined but accessible, sophisticated but cosy, for everyone but not just anyone". At a short distance from the most important artistic and cultural attractions of this wonderful city, Hotel Belludi37 will surprise and enthral you on each visit.
